title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 09 January 2012 - XWiki
content: 00:16  has quit 00:17  has left #xwiki 02:14  has quit 02:16  has joined #xwiki 02:16  Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r950acb0 / (2 files): [misc] Added missing copyright header - http://git.io/JtoIAQ 02:46  Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r09d57a2 / (3 files): XWIKI-7355: Use PNG silk icons instead of GIF ... 02:51  has quit 03:35  has joined #xwiki 06:00  has joined #xwiki 06:00  has quit 06:37  has quit 07:25  has joined #xwiki 08:14  has joined #xwiki 08:51  is now known as 09:10  has joined #xwiki 09:18  has joined #xwiki 09:41  has joined #xwiki 09:55  has joined #xwiki 10:09  has joined #xwiki 10:31  good morning 10:31  guys could you update http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap with your status? 10:32  (especially tmortagne, sergiu and mflorea) 10:32  (it's a good time to update our status since we're going to release 3.4M1 today) 10:33  btw the list of polishing is not very precise so if you can make it more precise in your domains that would be cool 10:33  domaines = app within minutes and EM 10:38 <+mflorea> I didn't get many replies to my mail listing the app within minutes bug fixes improvements so I we haven't agreed on a list for 3.4. I can list all 10:42  has quit 10:54  mflorea: I'm testing the new create space template sergiu has introduced 10:54  when i choose to create a space with the dashboard template, I get to the space home edited in wysiwyg mode with the dashboard macro in it 10:54  but the wysiwyg renders it empty 10:55  is that "normal"? 10:55  when I save the page I get to the see the correct result though 10:55  so it seems the wysiwyg is not wysiwyg! :) 10:55 <+mflorea> doesn't sound right, will look into it 10:55  if I edit the space home thereafter it's displayed correctly in the wysiwyg editor though 10:56  so it seems it's only when the page is created that there's an issue 11:16 <+tmortagne> vmassol: http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap is up to date for EM backend, I mostly committed dependencies of what is listed there and I should commit XR extension import tool today (writing test now). Will update the page as well as http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extension+Module as usual when it's done 11:16  ok thanks 11:17 <+tmortagne> I did not seen any commit from sdumitriu around EM so I think UI status is up to date too 11:28  has joined #xwiki 11:30  has quit 11:35 <+mflorea> vmassol: is "doc:" prefix required when serializing a link reference to a document? 11:36  don't remember. What serializer are you using? 11:36 <+mflorea> the WYSIWYG editor started producing doc:Space.Page link references since we set xwiki/2.1 as default syntax 11:37  well the official syntax is indeed: 11:37  : 11:37 <+mflorea> ok, in this case I have to update the tests, right? 11:37  parsers will default to the "doc" type or "url" when no type is specified though 11:37 <+mflorea> to assert doc:Space.page 11:38  probably yes 11:39  the test could be generic if you wanted 11:39  by using a serializer in your test and compare the result 11:39  (since your test is not about testing the serializer itself I guess) 11:39  up to you, maybe it's too much overhead I don't know 11:40 <+mflorea> yes, it's a bit too much. I could do this maybe when I move the tests to selenium 2 11:46  has joined #xwiki 11:56  has joined #xwiki 11:57  has quit 12:05  has quit 12:08  hmm seems we have a bug on xwiki.org: on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/News the first modification is the BuildManagerRoster but when you click on "see changes" it doesn't lead to the rigth subwiki 12:11  ok I see why, I'll reoprt it and fix it 12:19  has joined #xwiki 12:26  Vincent Massol master \* r616b5c1 / xwiki-enterprise-ui/src/main/resources/Main/Activity.xml : XWIKI-7360: Invalid "see changes" link in multiwiki mode for Activity stream event - http://git.io/1SeVHg 12:27  hmm isn't there any "stable" branch for xwiki-enterprise? 12:27  (in git) 12:27  ah found it 12:27  sorry 12:29  Vincent Massol stable-3.3.x \* r79e0285 / xwiki-enterprise-ui/src/main/resources/Main/Activity.xml : XWIKI-7360: Invalid "see changes" link in multiwiki mode for Activity stream event - http://git.io/VZyWdg 12:29  Vincent Massol stable-3.2.x \* rf09d49d / xwiki-enterprise-wiki/src/main/resources/Main/Activity.xml : XWIKI-7360: Invalid "see changes" link in multiwiki mode for Activity stream event - http://git.io/I1k-yw 12:36  tmortagne: we need to fix this: http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/GettingStarted#Comments 12:36  I'll try to find the time to open a request to upload it to maven central... 12:37 <+tmortagne> vmassol: indeed we tend to forget wikimodel, we really need too take some time to put it in rendering 12:38  maybe we should release a proper version of wikimodel before uploading to central? 12:38 <+tmortagne> well it's nicer for wikimodel project itself 12:47  has quit 13:05  has quit 13:07  has joined #xwiki 13:09  has joined #xwiki 13:47  has quit 13:48  has joined #xwiki 13:55  has joined #xwiki 14:50  has joined #xwiki 14:58  Eduard Moraru stable-3.3.x \* r2d6d265 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-workspace/xwiki-platform-workspace-ui/src/main/resources/WorkspaceManager/Install.xml : XWIKI-7353 : Fix workspace issues related to the fact that the local Admin is missing ... 15:22  tmortagne master \* r46ff87a / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/pom.xml : XWIKI-7349: Upgrade to AETHER 1.13.1 - http://git.io/rHMZnw 15:22  tmortagne master \* re0624f3 / (24 files in 16 dirs): XWIKI-7349: Upgrade to AETHER 1.13.1 ... 15:23  tmortagne master \* r82067d3 / (2 files in 2 dirs): Update test - http://git.io/6LLq6Q 15:26  Vincent Massol master \* r8d57298 / xwiki-enterprise-ui/src/main/resources/Main/Activity.xml : XWIKI-7360: Invalid "see changes" link in multiwiki mode for Activity stream event - http://git.io/oCbrGg 15:26  Vincent Massol stable-3.3.x \* r985acf2 / xwiki-enterprise-ui/src/main/resources/Main/Activity.xml : XWIKI-7360: Invalid "see changes" link in multiwiki mode for Activity stream event - http://git.io/LZxFRw 15:27  Vincent Massol stable-3.2.x \* r2aa7380 / xwiki-enterprise-wiki/src/main/resources/Main/Activity.xml : XWIKI-7360: Invalid "see changes" link in multiwiki mode for Activity stream event - http://git.io/zd6Hpg 15:34  tmortagne master \* r057f9f9 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/web/XWikiServletResponse.java : Revert modification committed by mistake - http://git.io/pU0JqA 15:39 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: I implemented XWIKI-5399 locally using a listener, but now 17 oldcore unit tests fail because my listener is active when running tests 15:40 <@sdumitriu> Is that by design? Shouldn't tests run in isolation, not in an environment with all the components active? 15:40  yes they should 15:41 <@sdumitriu> Any suggestions? 15:42  not really without looking further. I'm entering a conf call in a few minutes though so I cannot check now 15:42 <@sdumitriu> I don't want to change all tests to allow calls to exists(webhome) 15:42  you could unregister components but it's not very nice 16:00  has joined #xwiki 16:35  tmortagne master \* r249e57a / (3 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-7348: Provide UI to import and syncronise an external extension in the repository ... 16:42  has joined #xwiki 16:44  http://www.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/Home/WebHome bad typo on the second slide there: "Start up you professional" 16:44  instead of "Start up your professional" 16:48  also on the first slide, "more organized" than what? 16:50 <+mflorea> vmassol: (just checking) in xwiki/2.1 syntax, when doc: prefix is used, special URL symbols like @?# are not escaped anymore in the link reference. The doc: prefix removes the need to escape @ and query string + URL fragment are not parsed anymore from the link reference, they are specified separately as link parameters. Is this right? 16:50  otp 16:56 <+tmortagne> mflorea: no need to escape anything anymore because the parameters are not in the reference but in link parameters 16:57 <+mflorea> thanks tmortagne 16:57 <+tmortagne> it's not really related to doc: but the fact that @?# are not special symbol in anymore 16:58 <+mflorea> ok 16:58 <+tmortagne> anymore=in xwiki/2.1 syntax 17:12  has quit 17:13  tmortagne master \* rca4c2ca / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/web/XWikiServletResponse.java : Revert modification committed by mistake, again... - http://git.io/tYcsnQ 17:19  has quit 17:21  has joined #xwiki 17:22  has quit 17:22  has quit 17:41 <+mflorea> vmassol/tmortagne: it seems that the url: prefix is generated when converting a plain anchor like XWiki to xwiki/2.1 syntax. Is this the expected behavior? Note that the WYSIWYG editor doesn't generate the url: prefix if you insert a link to a web page through the wizard, but the url: prefix is generated if I paste a link. 17:41  that doesn't look good 17:42 <+mflorea> which behavior is correct: the wizard or the paste? 17:42  it should convert to "[[XWiki>>url:http://www.xwiki.org]]" instead 17:42 <+tmortagne> mflorea: well it is a url, not sure what's wrong here 17:42  oh url 17:42  sorry 17:42  I read "doc" 17:42  it's correct 17:42 <+tmortagne> what would you expect ? nothing ? 17:43 <+mflorea> so I should change the link wizard to generate the url: prefix also, right? 17:43  yes 17:43  that's the canonical form 17:43 <+tmortagne> as vmassol said before the canonical form of a reference is type:reference 17:43  (for XWiki Syntax 2.1) 17:44 <+mflorea> so basically you're saying that "typed" field of the resource reference should be also true (in calls coming from the WYSIWYG editor) 17:44 <+tmortagne> but I'm not sure what this has to do with WYSIWYG, it should only care about html 17:44 <+tmortagne> or you mean for the marker ? 17:45 <+mflorea> s/also/always 17:45 <+tmortagne> if you know the type then yes you should indicate it explicitely 17:45 <+mflorea> it wasn't the case before 17:45 <+tmortagne> the typed=false is here only to not "loose" the fact that the user did not set explicitely the type in the source 17:46  Sergiu Dumitriu master \* red2587d / (2 files): [misc] Fixed missing escaping - http://git.io/Cs4BEw 17:46 <+mflorea> the problem is that the link wizard must work both with xwiki/2.0 and xwiki/2.1 17:46 <+tmortagne> but if you create a new link in the WYSIWYG you should provide all the information you have 17:48 <+mflorea> I already provide all the info. The question is whether so set the "typed" field to true or false. For xwiki/2.0 I was setting this field based on the "type" field. From what you're saying now, for 2.1 syntax I should always set "typed" to true. 17:49 <+tmortagne> mflorea: the real issue is that the WYSIWYG is putting wiki syntax in the html, this will be fixed with generic markers based on xdom+xml syntax 17:49 <+tmortagne> we just need to move on this, putting xwiki syntax in the html always been a temporary hack 17:49 <+mflorea> I don't understand, where is the editor putting wiki syntax in html? 17:50 <+tmortagne> mflorea: in the marker 17:50 <+mflorea> no 17:50 <+mflorea> the marker is generic 17:50 <+tmortagne> if it's generic then  you don't have issue... 17:50 <+mflorea> false|-|url|-|http://www.xwiki.org 17:51 <+mflorea> I have, the first param of the marker, can be false or true 17:51 <+tmortagne> again if you know it's a URL you should set it to true 17:51 <+mflorea> the first param controls the "typed" field of the resource reference 17:52 <+tmortagne> this has nothing to do with xwiki/2.0 or 2.1 syntax this is reference informations 17:52 <+mflorea> ok, but what I'm saying is that it wasn't like this for 2.0 syntax and I need to have the same behavior for both syntaxes, ideally 17:52 <+tmortagne> the fact that xwiki/2.0 syntax does not support explicit type is just a limitation of it 17:53 <+tmortagne> at you level you are supposed to generate a proper XDOM/event not wiki syntax 17:53 <+tmortagne> that's xwiki/2.0 renderer job to take care of how to write a reference 17:54 <+tmortagne> the realy issue IMO is not what you should put in the marker but what the syntax supports or not 17:54 <+tmortagne> and there is lots of things not supported by xwiki/2.0 syntax 17:56 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: About the empty dashboard displayed when creating a new space, I think that we need to add a "save and view" action for templates; right now there's edit or save and edit 17:56  y'all don't every say "your" I take it. Might be the effective way. 17:56  sdumitriu: ok. mflorea was looking at it this morning, don't know what he found 17:56 <+tmortagne> mflorea: until now we had only one syntax really editable with the WYSIWYG because we did not have either renderer or parser for others but configuring WYSIWYG feature depending on the source syntax is becoming needed 17:57  JuanDaugherty: you lost me… :) 17:57   at you level, the typo on the front page, second slide, etc. 17:57 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: The problem would be fixed right now if we use "save and edit" as the template action, the WYSIWYG would find the right data in the document 17:58 <@sdumitriu> JuanDaugherty: It's a frenchmen problem 17:58  no doubt 17:58 <+tmortagne> not it's just a writing too quickly issue 18:00  (effective way to avoid your vs. you're, etc. just only use one uninflected word for every form of English second person) 18:01 <@sdumitriu> JuanDaugherty: "Your" right 18:01  you should figure out some way to embed documentation in your product 18:01 <@sdumitriu> Anyway, I'll see if I have rights to edit the xwikicom site 18:01 <@sdumitriu> JuanDaugherty: Working on it 18:01 <@sdumitriu> Will probably be on the roadmap for 4.x 18:03 <+mflorea> tmortagne: the fact is that I have this in my code: 18:03 <+mflorea> destination.setTyped(destination.getType() != ResourceType.URL); 18:03 <+mflorea> and I'm trying to remember why I put it for 2.0 syntax.. (i.e. why I didn't set it to true). 18:03  \*don't ever 18:03 <+mflorea> there was something for sure.. 18:04  JuanDaugherty: typo fixed 18:05  (one typo fixed, working on the other) 18:05  when a variable appears in a field of a form page like msg.get($obj.field.whatever) is it implicitly a velocity variable/function? 18:05  thanks! 18:06 <@sdumitriu> No 18:06 <@sdumitriu> It has to be explicitly evaluated 18:06 <@sdumitriu> We do that for the document title 18:07 <@sdumitriu> But for generic object properties, it shouldn't work out of the box 18:07  \* $msg.get("obj.field.whatever") 18:07  Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r461de35 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/createinline.vm : [misc] Fixed XHTML validity - http://git.io/H8VLrA 18:08 <@sdumitriu> JuanDaugherty: Ah, I see now 18:10 <@sdumitriu> That isn't in a field 18:10 <@sdumitriu> It's in the markup surrounding the display of fields 18:10 <@sdumitriu> And it should be wrapped by a {{velocity}} block, which triggers the evaluation of $msg.get 18:11  ah, OK, thx 18:19  so following up on that example, do I have to know the particular history of "obj.field.whatever" or is there a uniform way/place to find it? 18:19 <+tmortagne> mflorea: maybe it was to have the same thing in xwiki/2.0 and xwiki/2.1 result ? 18:20 <+tmortagne> it did not felt right when you seen a difference maybe ;) 18:32 <+mflorea> tmortagne: I don't remember.. anyway, I removed that line (typed=true by default) and I run all WYSIWYG link tests with 2.0 syntax as default for new pages and  they all pass. Maybe something has changed on the link rendering in the mean time. I'll commit it and we'll see if someone complains 18:48  has quit 18:55 <+tmortagne> mflorea: OK 18:56  has quit 18:56  Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r25cf0b8 / (3 files): XWIKI-7352: Make XWiki Syntax 2.1 the default syntax ... 19:07  Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rf49f4ff / (4 files in 2 dirs): [misc] Improved extension manager icons in the administration UI - http://git.io/z\_hBIQ 19:09  Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r5779cf5 / (4 files in 2 dirs): Merge branch 'master' of github.com:xwiki/xwiki-platform - http://git.io/SjXUjg 19:10  has quit 19:11  has quit 19:11  has left #xwiki 19:19  has joined #xwiki 19:32  has joined #xwiki 19:37 <@sdumitriu> Hi abusenius 19:37 <+abusenius> hi 19:37 <@sdumitriu> What do you think about putting the csrftoken in the HTML, in a ? 19:39 <+abusenius> im principle usually it is already in html, just in another tag 19:39 <@sdumitriu> Yes, it is 19:40 <+abusenius> so there should be no problems I think 19:40 <+abusenius> why do you want to hav it in meta? 19:40 <@sdumitriu> I don't see any major security problem, do you? 19:40 <@sdumitriu> Because I want to be able to access it from scripts that need to generate URLs with the token in them 19:40 <+abusenius> no, nothing I can think of 19:41 <+abusenius> in principle we could put it into a javascript variable 19:41 <@sdumitriu> For example, you put it directly in the Panels.DocumentInformation jsx, but since the script is usually cached in the browser, the token will get stale 19:41 <+abusenius> thee are anti-csrf solutions that only do that 19:42 <+abusenius> yes, we would need to make sure it is updated 19:42 <@sdumitriu> OK then, I'll proceed with the meta for the moment, thanks for your input 19:43 <+abusenius> ok 20:04  Sergiu Dumitriu master \* re250cdf / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7363: Changing the document syntax sometimes fails to properly migrate the content to the new syntax ... 20:04  Sergiu Dumitriu stable-3.3.x \* r90b0e30 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7363: Changing the document syntax sometimes fails to properly migrate the content to the new syntax ... 20:12  has quit 20:14  has joined #xwiki 20:28  Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r2275d1b / (2 files): XWIKI-7314: Advanced Install does not expand on IE8 ... 21:09  has joined #xwiki 21:21  has quit 21:23  has joined #xwiki 21:58  has quit 22:32  has joined #xwiki 22:34  has quit 22:37  has quit 23:31  has joined #xwiki
